intro: Trithuria bibracteata, commonly known as the two-bract trithuria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Hydrocharitaceae, which includes aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, green, ribbon-like leaves that float on the water surface. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are borne on short stalks. Trithuria bibracteata is often found in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats such as ponds and lakes.
